title: Microsoft Internet Explorer selectAll/RemoveFormat execCommand Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Internet Explorer. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The specific flaw exists within the selectAll/RemoveFormat command.  The execution of these commands can lead to a use-after-free condition.  An attacker can leverage this situation to execute code under the context of the user running the browser.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-059
timeline:
2013-05-13 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2013-08-13 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Jose A. Vazquez of Yenteasy - Security Research -
